medical_history.chief_complaint: blurred vision, dysarthria, and ataxia, which progressed to coma
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began abruptly at 6 p.m. the evening before admission, with weakness, shaking and buckling of legs, and clumsiness of the right hand. Approximately 20 minutes later, the patient's speech became slurred, and he experienced worsening dysarthria and blurred vision while being transported to another hospital. Upon arrival at the first hospital, he was assisted into a wheelchair, reporting being off-balance and light-headed. His symptoms progressed overnight to include violent shaking of his legs and arms and inability to speak, eventually leading to a locked-in state.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Previously healthy with a learning disability; scratched by a neighbor's dog 3 weeks before admission; removed an embedded tick 2 days before admission; no medications or allergies.
medical_history.family_history: Grandfather and mother had transient ischemic symptoms; maternal aunt died of neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis; a half-sibling had a learning disability.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with family; worked in a service position; attended 3 years of high school.
